subject: FAITH A NECESSITY
verse: The Lord said, “If you have faith as small as a mustard seed, you could say to this mulberry tree, ‘Be pulled up by the roots and be planted in the sea,’ and it would obey you. (Luke 17:6)
reflection:
It’s truly important that we learn the true meaning of faith. First
it is trusting Jesus to save the day, even when we see no evidence
of His immediate power. According to the Bible, only a tiny speck of faith is required to reap miracles. When anxiety sends our heart racing, we need to stop what we are doing and calm ourselves.
Then continue our task as we wait on Jesus to move the mountain. Give Jesus all your pressing fears. Stand still and wait for Him to fix what worries you.
prayer: Gracious God, help us to trust in Jesus with even the smallest measure of faith, knowing that You can work miracles in our lives. Grant us the peace to calm our anxious hearts and the patience to wait on Your perfect timing as we surrender our fears to You. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 16ffe3a38607b9aa
subject   : Subject: FAITH A NECESSITY (2-1-2020)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Fri, 31 Jan 2020 18:50:26 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*The Lord said, “If you have faith as small as a mustard seed, you could
say to this mulberry tree, ‘Be pulled up by the roots and be*

*planted in the sea,’ and it would obey you. *(Lk. 17:6)



*Today’s Reflection:*

It’s truly important that we learn the true meaning of faith. First

it is trusting Jesus to save the day, *even* when we see no evidence

of His immediate power. According to the Bible, only a tiny speck of faith
is required to reap miracles. When anxiety sends our heart racing, we need
to stop what we are doing and calm ourselves.

Then continue our task as we wait on Jesus to move the mountain.

*Give Jesus all your pressing fears. Stand still and wait for Him*

*to fix what worries you.*

* Pastor Al*

subject: FAITH PROVEN BY OBEDIENCE
verse: Whoever has My commandments and keeps them, he it is  who loves Me. And he who loves Me will be loved by My Father, and I will love him and manifest Myself to him.  (John 14:21)
reflection: God loves and reveals Himself to those who love and believe in Christ—a love shown by obedience to the Word. Make yourself known then and seen beforehand, lest you be un known for glory and known only for punishment. If Christ recognizes you in the [present] strife, He will recognize you in heaven.
prayer: Holy God, help us to demonstrate our love for Christ through obedience to Your Word, that we may be known and recognized by You both now and in eternity. May we strive to make ourselves known to You in this life, so that we may be welcomed into Your glorious presence in heaven. (AI)
original_content:

*Subject: FAITH PROVEN BY OBEDIENCE *(2-2-2020)



*Today’s Verse:*

*Whoever has My commandments and keeps them, he it is *

*who **loves Me. And he who loves Me will be loved by My Father, **and I
will love him and manifest Myself to him. *

(Jn. 14:21)



*Today’s Reflection:*

God loves and reveals Himself to those who love and

believe in Christ—a love shown by obedience to the

Word. Make yourself known then and seen beforehand,

lest you be *un*known for glory and known only for

punishment. *If Christ recognizes you in the **[present] *

*strife, He will recognize you in heaven. *

* Pastor Al*

subject: THE NEED TO REMAIN USEFUL
verse: Whoever wants to become great among you, must be your servant,  and whoever wants to be first must  be your slave—just as the Son of  Man did not come to be served, but  to serve, and give His life as a ransom for many. (Matthew 20:26-28)
reflection: One thing to remember in the church, is when we work together in harmony, the product of our labor is ageless and beautiful. Because our service is blessed by the Lord, we become a greater blessing to Him, part of a vast and timeless host of worshipers. What part will you play in Jesus’s masterpiece today?
prayer: Almighty God, as we serve You in harmony with our fellow believers, we pray that our collective efforts may create a beautiful and enduring testament to Your glory. Help us to recognize and fulfill our unique roles in Your grand design, becoming part of the timeless chorus of worship that honors You. (AI)
original_content:

*Today’s Verse:*

*Whoever wants to become great*

*among **you, must be your **servant, *

*and whoever wants to be first must *

*be your slave—**just as the Son of *

*Man did not come to be served, but *

*to **serve, and give His life as a ransom for many. *(Mt. 20:26-28)



*Today’s Reflection:*

One thing to remember in the church,

is when we work together in harmony,

the product of our labor is ageless and

beautiful. Because our service is blessed by the Lord, we become a

greater blessing to Him, part of a vast and timeless host of worshipers.

*What part will you play in **Jesus’s*

*masterpiece today?*

* Pastor Al*

subject: FOLLOWING THE EXAMPLE OF CHRIST
verse: Be full of love for others, following the example of Christ who loved you and  gave Himself to God as a sacrifice to take away your sins. And God was  pleased, for Christ’s love for you was  like a sweet perfume. (Ephesians 5:2)
reflection:
There is no greater example in all Scriptures then the one we see in the first line of (Ephesians 5:2). “Be full of love for others, following the example of Christ.” How have we been doing?
Iknow in my own life I have surely fallen short. A TRUE LOVE—is desires to please Christ, it’s not something extra
for the Christian. It is basic to Christian sanctity. It is not a dessert, but the main course—not a sideshow, but he main
tent.
It is not a motive to which we can resort to when convenient;
it is a controlling force to which we have committed our lives. This is the lifestyle of love: The question we need to ask ourselves is are we pleasing Christ?
prayer: Loving God, help us to follow Christ's example of true love, making it the controlling force in our lives rather than a mere convenience. May we continually strive to please You in all we do and say. (AI)
original_content:

*Today’s Verse:*

*Be full of love for others, following the example of Christ **who loved
you and *

*gave Himself to God as a sacrifice to*

*take away your sins. And God was *

*pleased, for Christ’s **love for you was *

*like a sweet perfume. *(Eph. 5:2)



*Today’s Reflection:*

There is no greater example in all

Scriptures then the one we see in the

first line of (Eph. 5:2). *“Be full of love *

*for others, **following the example of Christ.” * How have we been doing?

Iknow in my own life I have surely

fallen short. A TRUE LOVE—is desires

to please Christ, it’s not something extra

for the Christian. It is basic to Christian sanctity. It is not a dessert,
but the main course—not a sideshow, but he main

tent. It is not a motive to which we can resort to when convenient; it is a
controlling force to which we have committed our lives. *This is the
lifestyle of love: The question we **need to ask ourselves is are we
pleasing Christ**?*

*Pastor Al *

subject: IN THE FULLNESS OF TIME
verse: There is a time for everything, a season  for every activity under heaven. (Ecclesiastes 3:1)
reflection: Timing is important. All the experiences listed in the first eight verses of chapter eight are appropriate at certain times.The secret to peace with God is to discover, accept, and appreciate God’s perfect timing. The danger is to doubt or resent God’s timing. This can lead to despair, rebellion, or moving ahead without His advice.
prayer: Gracious God, help us to trust in Your perfect timing and to accept Your will with patience and faith. Guide us to appreciate the seasons of our lives, avoiding doubt and resentment, so that we may find peace in Your divine plan. (AI)
original_content:

*Today’s Verse:*

*There is a time for everything, a season *

*for every activity **under heaven. *(Eccl. 3:1) (read 3:1-8 for a clear
picture)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Timing is important. All the experiences listed in the first eight verses
of chapter eight are appropriate at certain times.The

secret to peace with God is to discover, accept, and appreciate God’s
perfect timing. The danger is to doubt or resent God’s timing. *This can
lead to despair, rebellion, **or moving ahead without **His *

*advice.*

* Pastor Al*

subject: A PLACE OF TRUE PEACE
verse: You keep him in perfect peace whose mind is stayed on You, because he trusts in You. (Isaiah 26:3)
reflection: Keeping our mind focused on our Savior can take practice. With today’s technology it is so easy to search the internet for different kinds of information. If you have some troublesome thoughts today, bring them to Jesus. If we bring our focus back to Jesus, our Savior, our mind will find a place of peace. Let’s clasp our hands, and look to Jesus, for true peace.
prayer: Holy God, help us to turn our hearts and minds toward Jesus, our source of peace and comfort, especially when we are troubled or distracted. May we find solace in Your presence as we seek to focus on our Savior amidst the noise and distractions of this world. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 17017cd465c58231
subject   : Subject: A PLACE OF TRUE PEACE (2-6-2020)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Wed, 5 Feb 2020 18:01:34 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*You keep him in perfect peace whose mind is stayed on **You, because he
trusts in You. *(Isa. 26:3)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Keeping our mind focused on our Savior can take practice. With today’s
technology it is so easy to search the internet for different kinds of
information. If you have some troublesome thoughts today, bring them to
Jesus. If we bring our focus back to Jesus, our Savior, our mind will find
a place of peace. *Let’s clasp our hands, and look to Jesus, for true
peace.*

* Pastor Al*

subject: IS OUR SECULAR WISDOM FOOLISHNESS?
verse: [A rich man] thought to himself. “What shall I do? I have no place to store my crops—I will tear down my barns and build bigger ones.”  (Luke 12:17, 18)
reflection:
“Wisdom may best describe our present scientific and cultural plateau, yet spiritually we are foolish for sure. Many men, seen as wise in the eyes of the world, are foolish in the eyes of our God. God, in no certain terms, has said, “Fools make a mock at sin” (Proverbs 14:9).
Our world says, “Do what makes you feel good;
do your own thing!” God has said. “He that trusts in his own heart is a fool” (Proverbs 28:26).
The rich farmer in the twelfth chapter of Luke, who found comfort in his accumulation of worldly goods, would be seen by many among us today as a very wise man. But God called him a fool (Luke: 12:20).
Our nation seems to be floating with the tide of moral and spiritual corruption. Are you drifting with the tide, or are you willing to stem the tide—I would rather be fool in the eyes of a foolish world, than a fool in the eyes of my all wise Creator.
prayer: Almighty God, grant us the wisdom to discern Your truth amidst the world's folly, and the courage to stand firm in Your ways even when it means going against the tide of popular opinion. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 1701cf299f4a6e06
subject   : Subject: IS OUR SECULAR WISDOM FOOLISHNESS? (2-7-2020)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Thu, 6 Feb 2020 18:00:26 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*[A rich man] thought to himself. “What shall I do? I have **no place to
store my **crops—I will tear down my barns and **build bigger ones.” * (Lk.
12:17, 18)



*Today’s Reflections:*

“Wisdom may best describe our present scientific and cultural plateau,
yet spiritually
we are foolish for sure. Many men, seen as wise in the eyes of the world,
are

foolish in the eyes of our God. God, in no certain terms,

has said, “Fools make a mock at sin” (Prov. 14:9).

Our world says, “Do what makes you feel good; do your own thing!” God
has said. “He that trusts in his own heart is a fool” (Prov. 28:26).

The rich farmer in the twelfth chapter of Luke, who found comfort in his
accumulation of worldly goods, would be seen by many among us today as a
very wise

man. *But* God called him a fool (Luke: 12:20).

Our nation seems to be floating with the tide of moral and spiritual
corruption.

* Are you drifting with the tide, or are **you willing to *

*stem the tide—I would rather be fool in **the eyes of a **foolish **world,
than a fool in the eyes of my **all wise *

*Creator. *

* Pastor Al*

subject: FAILURE TO TAKE OWNERSHIP:
verse: Then the man with one bag of silver came and said, “Master, I knew you are a hard man, harvesting crops you did not plant, and gathering crops you didn’t cultivate. I was afraid I would lose your money, so  I hid it in the earth. Look here is your money back.”  (Matthew 25:24-25)
reflection:
There have been times I have struggled with taking ownership of my mistakes, until Jesus convinced me to own up to them. Facing the truth that I was to fault wasn’t easy. Taking the step To take ownership of my struggle helped me understand other areas in my life, and it put me on the path to transformation and freedom. Do you make excuses or blame others to avoid
taking responsibility?
prayer: Merciful God, help us to courageously face our faults and take ownership of our mistakes, just as Jesus teaches us. Guide us towards transformation and freedom through honest self-reflection and accountability. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 170224aac5548cfe
subject   : Subject: FAILURE TO TAKE OWNERSHIP: (2-8-2020)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Fri, 7 Feb 2020 18:54:44 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Then the man with one bag of silver came and said, “Master, I **knew you
are a hard man, harvesting crops you did not plant, **and gathering crops
you didn’t cultivate. I was afraid I would **lose your money, so *

*I hid it in the earth. Look here is your **money back.” *

(Mat. 25:24-25)



*Today’s Reflection:*

There have been times I have struggled with taking ownership of my
mistakes, until Jesus convinced

me to own up to them. Facing the truth that I was to

fault wasn’t easy. Taking the step To take ownership

of my struggle helped me understand other areas in

my life, and it put me on the path to transformation

and freedom.

* Do you make excuses or blame others to avoid*

*taking responsibility? *

* Pastor Al*

subject: NOT GOOD TO BE DETACHED
verse: Let us consider one another in order to stir up love and good works, not forsaking the assembling of ourselves together, as is the manner of some, but exhorting one another, and so much the more as you see the DAY approaching. (Hebrews 10:24-25)
reflection:
Of how much good is a church member, detached from the rest? How much fruit can a branch bear, detached from the vine? How good is your hand when it is, detached from the body?
When we come together in the church as an assembly,
Paul wrote, we are to help each other to “stir up love
and good works.” We need love and good works to be
able to reach the unsaved in the world today. At times,
we need to just surround ourselves with the love of one
another and encourage each other, knowing that our
hope for all things is in our Savior, Jesus Christ.
A Christian is one who stays with the rest of the
church.
prayer: Faithful God, help us to remain connected to your church, stirring up love and good works in one another as we encourage each other and reach out to the world with the hope of Jesus Christ. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 170274914727948b
subject   : Subject: NOT GOOD TO BE DETACHED (2-9-2020)

*Today’s Verse:*

*Let us consider one another in order to stir up love and*

*good works, not forsaking the assembling of ourselves*

*together, as is the manner of some, but exhorting one*

*another, and so much the more as you see the DAY*

*approaching. *(Heb. 10:24-25)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Of how much good is a church member, detached

from the rest? How much fruit can a branch bear, detached from the vine?
How good is your hand when

it is, detached from the body?

When we come together in the church as an assembly,

Paul wrote, we are to help each other to “stir up love

and good works.” We need love and good works to be

able to reach the unsaved in the world today. At times,

we need to just surround ourselves with the love of one

another and encourage each other, knowing that our

hope for all things is in our Savior, Jesus Christ.

* A Christian is one who stays with the rest of the*

*church.*

* Pastor Al*

subject: DISCIPLINE ENCOURAGES SELF---CONTROL
verse: No discipline is enjoyable while it is happening—it is painful! Later on, however, it produces a harvest of righteousness and peace for those who have been trained by it. (Hebrews 12:11)
prayer: Gracious God, help us to accept Your loving discipline with gratitude and humility, recognizing it as a sign of Your care for us. Open our hearts to learn from Your correction and grow in faith and obedience to Your will. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 1702c8493eeb51e3
subject   : Subject: DISCIPLINE ENCOURAGES SELF---CONTROL (2-10-2020)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sun, 9 Feb 2020 18:34:11 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*No discipline is enjoyable while it is happening—it is*

*painful! Later on, however, it produces a harvest of*

*righteousness and peace for those who have been*

*trained by it. *Heb. 12:11)



*Today’s Reflection:*

We may respond to discipline in several ways:

(1) We can accept it with resignation;

(2) We can accept it with pity;

(3) We can be angry and resentful toward

God or

(4) We can accept it gratefully, as the
appropriate response we owe a

loving Father.

*When God corrects you, see it as proof of His love,*

*and ask Him what He is trying to teach you.*

* Pastor Al *

subject: BE A FAITHFUL PRAYER WARRIOR
verse: And so, from the day we heard, we have not ceased  to pray for you, asking that you may be filled with  the knowledge of His will in all spiritual wisdom  and understanding. (Colossians 1:9)
reflection:
Many of our church members are included in our prayer chain. Whenever there is a prayer concern or a praise report, text messages are sent to those in the prayer group. Technology has allowed the people to contact each other quickly and keep everyone updated.
Praying brings people closer to Jesus; praying for others is good and pleasing in the sight of our Savior. Jesus honors the prayers of those who love Him. He unleashes hope, healing, mercy, and grace for those that we pray for.
Let us join together and lift up those in need.
prayer: Loving God, we thank you for the technology that allows us to quickly share prayer requests and praises, bringing us closer to you and each other. Help us to faithfully lift up those in need, trusting that you hear our prayers and respond with hope, healing, mercy, and grace. (AI)
original_content:

*Today’s Verse:*

*And so, from the day we heard, we have not ceased *

*to pray for **you, asking that you may be filled **with *

*the **knowledge of His **will in all spiritual wisdom *

*and understanding.* (Col. 1:9)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Many of our church members are included in our

prayer chain. Whenever there is a prayer concern

or a praise report, text messages are sent to those

in the prayer group. Technology has allowed the

people to contact each other quickly and keep

everyone updated. Praying brings people closer

to Jesus; praying for others is good and pleasing in

the sight of our Savior. Jesus honors the prayers of

those who love Him. He unleashes hope, healing,

mercy, and grace for those that we pray for.

*Let us join together and lift up those in need.*

* Pastor Al*

subject: HE CARES FOR YOU
verse: Let Him have all your worries and cares, for He is  always thinking about you and watching everything  that concerns you. (I Peter 5:7)
reflection:
Just before His crucifixion, Jesus told His disciples, “Don’t let your heart be troubled (John 14:1). The question I have heard is how is this possible in our fallen world where terrible things happen every day? Jesus gave the answer at the end of the verse: “Trust [Believe in some translations] in Me.” Do we trust Him with a scary medical diagnosis, a wayward spouse or child, a sudden Job loss? If we trust
Jesus to take care of everything that concerns us, then our faces will reflect that. Look in the mirror. What message does your face reflect?
Peace and trust in Jesus, or stress? (Recite John 14:1 until you smile).
prayer: Holy God, help us to trust in You completely, even in the face of life's challenges and uncertainties, so that our countenances may reflect the peace that surpasses all understanding. May we internalize Your words of comfort and find strength in believing, allowing Your light to shine through us. (AI)
original_content:

*Today’s Verse:*

*Let Him have all your worries and cares, for He is *

*always **thinking about you and watching everything *

*that concerns **you. *(I Pet. 5:7)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Just before His crucifixion, Jesus told His disciples, “Don’t let your
heart be troubled (Jn. 14:1). The question I have heard is how is this
possible in our

fallen world where terrible things happen every day? Jesus gave the answer at
the end of the verse: *“Trust [Believe *in some translations] in Me.” Do we
trust

Him with a scary medical diagnosis, a wayward

spouse or child, a sudden Job loss? If we trust

Jesus to take care of everything that concerns us,

then our faces will reflect that. *Look in the mirror.* *What message **does
your face reflect? Peace and trust in Jesus, or stress? **(Recite Jn 14:1
until you smile).*

* Pastor Al*

subject: GOD'S MASTER PIECE
verse: For the Spirit God gave us does not make us timid,  but gives us power, love and self-discipline.  (2 Timothy 1:7)
reflection:
My favorite identity tag is found in Ephesians 2:10. I prefer the New Living Translation for this verse. “For we are God’s master piece…”
Beauty is often only achieved and appreciated through pain.
Love can be witnessed is suffering. Courage is won in faith. We are loving, beauty, and brave, because we are His masterpiece.
Divide a piece of paper in two columns. On one side, list fears you have overcome. On the other side, note your current fears and beneath each one, write ways Jesus has armed you to face it.
prayer: Almighty God, thank You for creating us as Your masterpieces, shaping us through both joys and trials to reflect Your love, beauty, and courage. Help us to face our fears with faith, remembering how You have equipped and strengthened us in the past. (AI)
original_content:

subject   : Subject: GOD'S MASTER PIECE (2-13-2020)

*Today’s Verse:*

*For the Spirit God gave us does not make us timid, *

*but gives **us power, love and self-discipline. *

(2 Tim. 1:7)



*Today’s Reflection:*

My favorite identity tag is found in Eph. 2:10.

I prefer the New Living Translation for this verse.

*“For we are God’s **master piece…”*

Beauty is often only achieved and appreciated

through pain. Love can be witnessed is suffering. Courage is won in faith.
We are loving, beauty,

and brave, because we are His masterpiece.

* Divide a piece of paper in two columns. On *

*one side, **list fears you have overcome. On the *

*other side, note **your current fears and beneath *

*each one, write ways **Jesus has armed you to face *

*it.*

* Pastor Al *

subject: THREE LOVES
verse: Jesus said…”You shall Love the Lord your God with all your heart, with all your soul, and with  all your mind. This is the first and great command. And the second is like it, ‘You shall love your neighbor as yourself. (Matthew 22:37-39)
reflection: When I was young I had to memorized these verses but it became difficult for me to under- stand the third part of this verse because I thought loving myself a vain, prideful thing to do. In other words, not a Christian thing. But it was explained to me that it grieves God when we treat ourselves poorly. Just as it would if we treated a brother or sister in Christ poorly. When you find yourself being to critical, negative, or demanding with yourself today, ask yourself: Is this how I would treat my best friend? [Then be kind to yourself.] Remember Jesus loves you and wants you to love yourself too.
prayer: Gracious God, help us to see ourselves through Your loving eyes and treat ourselves with the same kindness and compassion we extend to others. May we embrace Your love for us and learn to love ourselves as Your precious children, reflecting Your grace in all aspects of our lives. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 170412a6f3a6d285
subject   : Subject: THREE LOVES (2-14-2020)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Thu, 13 Feb 2020 18:47:45 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Jesus said…”You shall Love the Lord your God with all **your heart, with
all your soul, and with *

*all your mind. **This is the first and great command. And the second is **like
it, ‘You shall love your neighbor as yourself. *(Mt. 22:37-39)



*Today’s Reflection: *

When I was young I had to memorized these

verses but it became difficult for me to under-

stand the third part of this verse because I thought loving myself a vain,
prideful thing to do. In other words, not a Christian thing. But it was
explained to me that it grieves God when we treat ourselves

poorly. Just as it would if we treated a brother or

sister in Christ poorly. When you find yourself being to critical,
negative, or demanding with yourself today, ask yourself: *Is this how I
would treat my best friend?*

*[Then be kind to yourself.] Remember Jesus loves **you and wants you to
love yourself too.*

*Pastor Al*

subject: IT'S ALL PART OF A PLAN
verse: I will praise You, for I am fearfully and wonderfully made; marvelously are your works, and that my soul knows very well. (Psalm 139:14)
reflection:
This Scripture should give comfort to all who are mature in Christ, because Jesus assures us that we were made with tender loving care. Not only that, we are a marvelous creation!
Therefore, we can hold our head up high in every social situation. So, let us allow our confidence in Christ help us in social situations to reach the lost.
prayer: Loving God, thank you for creating us with tender care and making us marvelous in your sight. Help us to walk confidently in this truth, using our assurance in Christ to connect with others and share your love with those who need it most. (AI)

*Today’s Verse:*

*I will praise You, for I am fearfully and wonderfully made; **marvelously
are your works, and that my soul knows very **well. *(Ps. 139:14)



*Today’s Reflection:*

This Scripture should give comfort to all who are mature in Christ, because
Jesus assures us that we were made with tender loving care. Not only that,
we are a marvelous creation! Therefore, we can hold our head up high in
every social situation.

*So, let us allow our confidence in Christ **help *

*us in social situations to reach the lost.*

* Pastor Al*

subject: ANSWERS BEYOND YOUR EXPECTATION
verse: Jesus responded, “Didn’t I tell you that you  would see God’s glory if you believe? (John 11:40)
reflection: Over the years I’ve learned that despite apparent circumstances, it’s best for me to simply trust Jesus. When I do, I come up a winner in the end. If you are praying for something today don’t keep Jesus in a box. Expect Him to answer beyond your expectations.
prayer: Lord Jesus, help us to trust You fully, even when circumstances seem challenging or uncertain. Expand our faith and expectations, so that we may witness Your power to answer prayers in ways that surpass our understanding. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 1704b572ec8b8347

*Today’s Verse:*

*Jesus responded, “Didn’t I tell you that you *

*would see God’s **glory if you believe? *(Jn. 11:40)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Over the years I’ve learned that despite apparent circumstances, it’s best
for me to simply trust Jesus. When I do, I come up a winner in the end.

*If you are praying for something today **don’t*

*keep **Jesus in a box. Expect Him to answer *

*beyond **your expectations.*

* Pastor Al *

subject: AN ETERNAL PURPOSE 2-17-2020)
verse: You study the Scriptures diligently because you think  that in them you have eternal life. These are the very Scriptures that testify about me, yet you refuse to come  to me to have life. (John 5:39-40)
reflection: Our lives are not just about the clamoring GPS of the law pushing us to the final destination—not if that makes us miss our true Savior, Jesus leads us on a rich path. Each day, each moment, is an opportunity to commune with Him, to learn to follow Him, to allow Him to change us. Yes, He grants eternal life. But He also grants eternal purpose to our present days. Ask Him to reveal His purpose for you today.
prayer: Gracious God, help us to quiet the clamoring voices of obligation and instead attune our hearts to the gentle guidance of Jesus, our true Savior. May we embrace each moment as an opportunity to commune with You, allowing Your transformative presence to reveal our eternal purpose in the here and now. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 170505a49b2589d8
subject   : Subject: AN ETERNAL PURPOSE 2-17-2020)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sun, 16 Feb 2020 17:34:19 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*You study the Scriptures diligently because you think *

*that in **them you have eternal life. These are the very Scriptures **that
testify about me, yet you refuse to come *

*to me to have **life. *(Jn. 5:39-40)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Our lives are not just about the clamoring GPS of the

law pushing us to the final destination—not if that

makes us miss our true Savior, Jesus leads us on a rich path. Each day,
each moment, is an opportunity *to* commune with Him, *to* learn to follow
Him*, to *allow Him to change us. *Yes, *He grants eternal life. *But* He
also grants eternal purpose to our present days. *Ask *

*Him to reveal His **purpose for you today.*

* Pastor Al*

subject: THE ALL IMPORTANT WORD
verse: Then they [the religious council] became insistent.  “But He is causing riots by his teaching wherever  he goes—all over Judea, from Galilee to Jerusalem!” (Luke 23:5)
reflection: I wonder how many of those desperate council members were transformed by Christ’s death and resurrection. I wonder how many later longed to reword their complaints against Him, saying, “He caused a riot in my soul, and I’ll never be the same again”? What one word describes the riot Jesus caused in your life? Redeemed? Restored? Alive? Hopeful? Why not--(Live it!)
prayer: Holy God, stir up a holy riot in our souls, transforming us through the power of Christ's death and resurrection. May we be forever changed, redeemed, and filled with hope as we live out our faith in You. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 17055d0478b31d04
subject   : Subject: THE ALL IMPORTANT WORD (2-18-2020)

to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Mon, 17 Feb 2020 19:01:18 -0600

*Today’s Verse:*

*Then they [the religious council] became insistent. *

*“But **He is causing riots by his teaching wherever *

*he goes—**all over Judea, from Galilee to Jerusalem!” *(Lk. 23:5)


*Today’s Reflection:*

I wonder how many of those desperate council

members were transformed by Christ’s death and resurrection. *I wonder
*how many
later longed to

reword their complaints against Him, saying, “He

caused a riot in my soul, and I’ll never be the same

again”? *What one word describes the riot Jesus*

*caused in your life? Redeemed? Restored? *

*Alive? **Hopeful? Why not--**(Live it!) *

* Pastor Al*

subject: A GENUINE REASON FOR PRAISING
verse:
Praise the Lord, all you nations. Praise Him, all you people of the earth. For He loves us with unfailing love;
the faithfulness of the Lord endures forever. (Psalm 117:1-2)
reflection:
Not only is Psalm 117 one of the shortest chapters in
the Bible, it is also the middle chapter. In Romans 15:11
Paul quotes these verses to show that God’s salvation
is for all people not just Jews.
Have you ever said, “I can’t think of anything God
has done for me. How can I praise Him?” This Psalm
gives two reasons for praising God, His unfailing love
toward us and His faithfulness lasts forever. If He did nothing else for us, He would still be worthy of our highest praise.
prayer: Faithful God, we thank You for Your unfailing love and eternal faithfulness, which are reason enough to offer our highest praise. Help us to remember these truths always, and to join with all people in glorifying Your name. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 1705ae224133efb3
subject   : Subject: A GENUINE REASON FOR PRAISING 2-19-2020)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Tue, 18 Feb 2020 18:38:55 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verses:*

*Praise the Lord, all you nations. Praise Him, all you*

*people of the earth. For He loves us with unfailing*

*love; the faithfulness of the Lord endures forever.*

(Ps. 117:1-2)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Not only is Psalm 117 one of the shortest chapters in

the Bible, it is also the middle chapter. In Ro. 15:11

Paul quotes these verses to show that God’s salvation

is for all people not just Jews.

Have you ever said, “I can’t think of anything God

has done for me. How can I praise Him?” This Psalm

gives two reasons for praising God, *His unfailing love *

*toward us and His faithfulness lasts forever.* *If He did*

*nothing else for us, He would still be worthy of our *

*highest praise.*

* Pastor Al*

subject: WHAT DOES YOUR FAITH REFLECT?
verse: For though your hearts were once full of darkness,  now you are full of light from the Lord, and your behavior should show it. (Ephesians 5:8)
reflection:
As people filled with light, our actions should reflect our faith.
We should live beyond reproach so that we will reflect God’s goodness to others. Jesus stressed this truth in the Sermon on the Mount. (Matthew 5:15-16)
prayer: Lord of Life, help us to shine brightly as reflections of Your goodness, living in a way that draws others to Your light and glorifies You through our actions. May our faith be evident in all we do, as Jesus taught us. (AI)
original_content:

subject   : Subject: WHAT DOES YOUR FAITH REFLECT? (2-20- 2020)

*Today’s Verse:*

*For though your hearts were once full of darkness, *

*now **you are full of light from the Lord, and your behavior **should show
it. *(Eph. 5:8)



*Today’s Reflection:*

As people filled with light, our actions should reflect

our faith. We should live beyond reproach so that we

will reflect God’s goodness to others. *Jesus stressed *

*this **truth in the Sermon on the Mount. *(Mt. 5:15-16)

*Pastor Al *

subject: A FRIEND IS..
verse: Now, no one is likely to die for a good person, though someone might be willing to die for a person who is especially good—But God showed His great love for us by sending Christ to die for us while we were yet sinners. (Romans 5:8-9)
reflection: A friend is—a push when you’re stopped. A friend is—a guide when you’re searching. A friend is—a song when you’re glad. A friend is—a word when you’re lonely. A friend is—a smile when you’re sad.
prayer: Gracious God, thank You for the gift of true friendship that supports us through life's joys and challenges. Help us to be that kind of friend to others, offering encouragement, guidance, and compassion as we journey together. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 170650c881fa2191
subject   : Subject: A FRIEND IS...(2-21-2020)

*Today’s Verse:*

*Now, no one is likely to die for a good person, though*

*someone might be willing to die for a person who is*

*especially good—But God showed His great love for*

*us by sending Christ to die for us while we were yet*

*sinners. *(Ro. 5:8-9)



*Today’s Reflection:*

*A friend is*—a push when you’re stopped.

*A friend is*—a guide when you’re searching.

*A friend is*—a song when you’re glad.

*A friend is*—a word when you’re lonely.

*A friend is*—a smile when you’re sad.

*Pastor Al*

subject: A MORE PERFECT GLORY
verse: And all of us have had that veil removed so that we can be mirrors that brightly reflect to glory of the Lord . And as the Spirit of the Lord works within us, we become more and more like Him and reflect His glory even more. (2 Corinthians 3:18)
reflection:
The glory that the Spirit imparts to the believer is
more excellent and lasts longer than the glory that
Moses experienced. By gazing at the nature of God
with unveiled minds, we can be more like Him. In
the Good News we see the truth about Christ, and
it transforms us morally as we understand and apply it.
Through learning about Christ’s life, we can understand how wonderful God is and what he
really is like. As our knowledge deepens, the Holy
Spirit helps us to change. Becoming Christlike Is a progressive experience. (Romans 8:29)
prayer: Holy God, as we gaze upon Your glory with unveiled minds, transform us by Your Spirit to reflect the image of Christ more fully. Help us to grow in our understanding of Your truth, that we may be continually changed into Your likeness. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 1706a5f1c45e4da4
subject   : Subject: A MORE PERFECT GLORY (2-22-2020) /';../
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Fri, 21 Feb 2020 18:49:43 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*And all of us have had that veil removed so that we*

*can be mirrors that brightly reflect to glory of the*

*Lord . And as the Spirit of the Lord works within us, **we become more and
more like Him and reflect His **glory even more. *(2 Cor. 3:18)



*Today’s Reflection:*

The glory that the Spirit imparts to the believer is

more excellent and lasts longer than the glory that

Moses experienced. By gazing at the nature of God

with unveiled minds, we can be more like Him. In

the Good News we see the truth about Christ, and

it transforms us morally as we understand and apply it. Through learning
about Christ’s life, we can understand how wonderful God is and what he

really is like. As our knowledge deepens, the Holy

Spirit helps us to change. *Becoming Christlike*

*Is a progressive experience*. (Ro. 8:29)

*Pastor Al*

subject: OFFER PRAYER
verse: Because I love Zion, because my heart yearns  for Jerusalem, I cannot remain silent. I will not stop praying for her until her righteousness shine like the dawn. And her salvation blazes like a burning torch. (Isaiah 62:1)
reflection:
We should have Isaiah’s zeal to see God’s will done. This is what we mean when we pray, “May Your Kingdom come soon. May Your will be done here on earth, just as it is in heaven.”
It is good to keep praying persistently for others.
prayer: Faithful God, ignite in us the same passion Isaiah had for seeing Your will fulfilled, and grant us the perseverance to pray unceasingly for others, that Your Kingdom may come and Your will be done on earth as it is in heaven. (AI)
original_content:

*Today’s Verse:*

*Because I love Zion, because my heart yearns *

*for Jerusalem, **I cannot remain silent. I will not stop praying for her
until **her righteousness shine like the dawn. And her salvation **blazes
like a burning torch. *(Isa. 62:1)



*Today’s Reflection*

We should have Isaiah’s zeal to see God’s will done. This is what we mean
when we pray,

“May Your Kingdom come soon. May Your will

be done here on earth, just as it is in heaven.”

*It is good to keep praying persistently for others.*

* Pastor Al*

subject: BEHAVIOR IS EVERYTHING
verse: Be kind to each other, tenderhearted, forgiving  one another, just as God through Christ has forgiven you. (Ephesians 4:32)
reflection:
Remember we bring sorrow to the Holy Spirit by the way we live. In verses 28-31 Paul warns us against unwholesome language, bitterness, improper use of anger, harsh words, slander, and bad attitudes toward others. Instead of acting
that way, we should be forging just as God has forgiven us.
Are you bring sorrow or pleasing God with your attitudes and actions? Act in love toward your brothers and sisters in Christ. We are called to do that because God acted in love by sending His Son to die for our sins.
prayer: Merciful God, help us to turn away from attitudes and actions that grieve Your Holy Spirit, and instead empower us to forgive and love others as You have forgiven and loved us through Christ. May our lives reflect Your grace and bring You joy rather than sorrow. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 17074a7921e045a3
subject   : Subject: BEHAVIOR IS EVERYTHING (2-24-2020)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sun, 23 Feb 2020 18:45:04 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Be kind to each other, tenderhearted, forgiving *

*one **another, just as God through Christ has forgiven **you. *(Eph.
4:32) (read Eph. 4:28-31)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Remember we bring sorrow to the Holy Spirit

by the way we live. In verses 28-31 Paul warns

us against unwholesome language, bitterness, improper use of anger, harsh
words, slander, and

bad attitudes toward others. Instead of acting

that way, we should be forging just as God has forgiven us. Are you bring
sorrow or pleasing

God with your attitudes and actions? Act in love toward your brothers and
sisters in Christ. *We *

*are called to do that because **God acted in love by sending His Son to
die for our sins.*

* Pastor Al*

subject: HOW TO SATISFY GOD
verse: Jesus told them, “This is what God wants you to do: Believe in the One He has sent.” (John 6:29)
reflection:
Many sincere seekers were wondering what God wanted them to do. Many of the religions of the world are mankind’s attempts to answer this question. But Jesus’s reply is brief and simple. We must believe on Him who God has sent.
Remember this satisfying God does not come from the works we do, but in whom we believe. The first step is accepting that Jesus is who He claims to be. All spiritual development is built on this affirmation. Now its up to you to; Declare to Jesus, “You are the Messiah, the Son of the living God.
prayer: Gracious God, help us to embrace the simple truth that believing in Jesus, whom You sent, is the foundation of our spiritual journey. May we declare with conviction that Jesus is the Messiah, the Son of the living God, and build our lives upon this unwavering faith. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 17079d4b9d5ec90e
subject   : Subject: HOW TO SATISFY GOD (2-25-2020)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Mon, 24 Feb 2020 18:52:29 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Jesus told them, “This is what God wants you to do: Believe **in the One
He has sent.” *(Jn. 6:29)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Many sincere seekers were wondering what God

wanted them to do. Many of the religions of the world are mankind’s
attempts to answer this question. But Jesus’s reply is brief and simple. We
must believe on Him who God has sent. Remember this satisfying God does not
come from the works we do, but in whom we believe. The first step is
accepting that Jesus is who He claims to be. All spiritual development is
built on this affirmation. Now its up to you to; *Declare to Jesus, “You
are the Messiah, **the Son of the living God.*

* Pastor Al*

subject: MORE THEN A CONQUEROR
verse: Thank God! For He gave us victory over sin and death through our Lord Jesus Christ. (I Corinthians 15:57)
reflection:
As we know Ash Wednesday ushers in Lent—a time of
reflection, self-sacrifice, spiritual discipline, and fasting
to prepare our hear for Easter. Ash Wednesday reminds
us of our morality (ashes to ashes, dust to dust) and our
sinfulness but also that our mortality and sin have been
conquered through the death and resurrection of our
Lord Jesus Christ. Our humanity and our sinfulness have been conquered in Jesus and we are free.
prayer: Holy God, as we enter this season of Lent, help us to reflect deeply on our mortality and sinfulness, while also rejoicing in the freedom and victory we have through Christ's death and resurrection. May our hearts be prepared for Easter through meaningful reflection, discipline, and sacrifice. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 1707ec7acfc021d6
subject   : Subject: MORE THEN A CONQUEROR (2-26-20200
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Tue, 25 Feb 2020 17:56:20 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Thank God! For He gave us victory over sin and death*

*through our Lord Jesus Christ. *(I Cor. 15:57)



*Today’s Reflection:*

As we know Ash Wednesday ushers in Lent—a time of

reflection, self-sacrifice, spiritual discipline, and fasting

to prepare our hear for Easter. Ash Wednesday reminds

us of our morality (ashes to ashes, dust to dust) and our

sinfulness *but also* that our mortality and sin have been

conquered through the death and resurrection of our

Lord Jesus Christ. *Our humanity and our sinfulness*

*have been conquered in Jesus and we are free.*

* Pastor Al *

subject: SATAN NEVER PLAYS FARE
verse: Jesus answered, (the Devil) “It is written: ‘man shall  not live by bread alone, but on every word that comes from the mouth of God.’” (Matthew 4:4)
reflection:
Remember the Devil doesn’t play fare. At this particular
time Jesus had been in the wilderness—40 days and forty
nights with out food and the devil tried to tempt Jesus in
turning stones into loaves of beard. But Jesus was able to resist the Devil's temptations because He not only knew Scripture, but He also obeyed it. Ephesians 6:17 says that God’s Word is a sword to use in spiritual combat. Knowing Bible verses is an important step in helping us resist the Devil’s attacks, but we must also obey the Bible. If you read Matthew 4;1-11 We see that Satan
had memorized Scriptures but He failed to obey it. The Bible help us follow God desires rather than The Devil’s.
prayer: Lord of Life, strengthen us with Your Word, that we may resist temptation and follow Your will faithfully, just as Jesus did in the wilderness. Help us not only to know Scripture but to obey it in our daily lives. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 1708409cb71f64dc
subject   : Subject: SATAN NEVER PLAYS FARE (2-27-2020)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Wed, 26 Feb 2020 18:26:39 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Jesus answered, *(the Devil) *“It is written: ‘man shall *

*not live **by bread alone, but on every word that comes from the mouth **of
God.’” *(Mat. 4:4) read (Mt. 4:1-11)


*Today’s Reflection:*

Remember the Devil doesn’t play fare. At this particular

time Jesus had been in the wilderness—40 days and forty

nights with out food and the devil tried to tempt Jesus in

turning stones into loaves of beard. *But* Jesus was able

to resist the Devil's temptations because He not only knew Scripture, *but *He
also obeyed it. Ephesians 6:17 says that God’s Word is a sword to use in
spiritual combat. Knowing Bible verses is an important step in helping us
resist the Devil’s attacks, *but * we must also obey the Bible. If you read
Mt. 4;1-11 We see that Satan

had memorized Scriptures *but* *He failed to obey it.*

*The Bible help us follow God desires rather than*

*The Devil’s.*

* Pastor Al*

subject: DISCIPLINED WITNESSES NEEDED
verse: Therefore, since we are surrounded by so great a cloud of witnesses, let us also lay aside every weight, and sin which clings so closely, and let us run with endurance  the race that is set before us. (Hebrews 12:1)
reflection:
(The great cloud of witnesses) are the people of faith
described in chapter 11. Their faithfulness should be
an encouragement to us. We do not struggle alone,
and we are not the first to struggle with problems we
face.
Others have run the race and won, and their
witness should stir us run and win. The Christian life
involves hard work. It requires us to give up whatever endangers our relationship with God, so let us keep our eyes on Jesus. We should be running for Him not ourselves.
prayer: Faithful God, inspire us to persevere in our faith journey, encouraged by the cloud of witnesses who have gone before us, and help us to keep our eyes fixed on Jesus as we run the race set before us. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 170893fe0b272bc2
subject   : Subject: DISCIPLINED WITNESSES NEEDED (2-28-2020)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Thu, 27 Feb 2020 18:43:50 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Therefore, since we are surrounded by so great a cloud*

*of witnesses, let us also lay aside every weight, and sin*

*which clings so closely, and let us run with endurance *

*the race that is set before us. *(Heb. 12:1)



*Today’s Reflection:*

(*The great cloud of witnesses*) are the people of faith

described in chapter 11. Their faithfulness should be

an encouragement to us. We do not struggle alone,

*and* we are not the first to struggle with problems we

face. Others have run the race and won, and their

witness should stir us run and win. The Christian life

involves hard work. *It requires us to give up whatever*

*endangers our relationship with God, so let us keep*

*our eyes on Jesus. We should be running for Him*

*not ourselves.*

* Pastor Al*

subject: CONSTANTLY ON GUARD
verse: Yea, though I walk through the valley of the  shadow of death, I will fear no veil; for thou art with me: thy rod and thy staff they comfort me. (Psalm 23:4)
reflection:
Jesus is so careful with those He loves.
He is constantly guarding us, saving us, and lifting us up. He is our shield and protector. He is our light in the dark. Under His wings, we will find refuge. Know that He is protecting you today.
Ask Jesus to put a hedge of protection around you and your loved ones.
prayer: Almighty God, thank You for Your constant care and protection, shielding us from harm and guiding us through darkness. We humbly ask that You surround us and our loved ones with Your divine protection, keeping us safe in Your loving embrace. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 1708e73b75ae740f
subject   : Subject: CONSTANTLY ON GUARD (2-29-2020)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Fri, 28 Feb 2020 18:58:33 -0600
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Yea, though I walk through the valley of the *

*shadow of **death, I will fear no veil; for thou art with me: thy rod **and
thy staff they comfort me. *(Ps. 23:4)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Jesus is so careful with those He loves. He is constantly guarding us,
saving us, and lifting us

up. He is our shield and protector. He is our light

in the dark. Under His wings, we will find refuge. Know that He is
protecting you today.

*Ask Jesus to put a hedge of protection around *

*you and **your loved ones.*

* Pastor Al*
